Properties.ProtectedString:
Tool = script.Parent
local stillEquipped = false
function onEquippedLocal(mouse) stillEquipped = true if mouse == nil then print("Mouse not found") return end while stillEquipped do print("Setting Mouse to go") mouse.Icon = "rbxasset://textures\\GunCursor.png" while Tool.Enabled and stillEquipped do wait(0.01) end print("Setting Mouse to wait") mouse.Icon = "rbxasset://textures\\GunWaitCursor.png" while not Tool.Enabled and stillEquipped do wait(0.01) end end end
function onUnequippedLocal() stillEquipped = false end
Tool.Equipped:connect(onEquippedLocal) Tool.Unequipped:connect(onUnequippedLocal)

math.randomseed(tick()); math.random()
local Tool = script.Parent local Wand = Tool.Handle
local CloneScript local ScriptToRemove local GuiToRemove
local debris = game:GetService("Debris")
local myMouse = Tool.Mouse
local myCharacter local myPlayer local ScreenGui local FakeShoulder local Torso local RightShoulder
local Sparkles = Instance.new("Sparkles") Sparkles.Name = "Wizard Wand Sparkles" Sparkles.SparkleColor = Color3.new(1, 0, 0)
local Tip = Instance.new("Part") Tip.Name = "Wizard Wand Tip" Tip.formFactor = Enum.FormFactor.Custom Tip.CanCollide = false Tip.Locked = true Tip.Size = Vector3.new(0.2, 0.2, 0.2) Tip.Transparency = 1.0
local TipWeld = Instance.new("Weld") TipWeld.Name = "Wizard Wand Tip Weld" TipWeld.Part0 = Wand TipWeld.Part1 = Tip TipWeld.C1 = CFrame.new(0, 0, -0.54)
local HelpGui = Tool:FindFirstChild("WizardWandHelpGui") if HelpGui then HelpGui = HelpGui:Clone() end
local HelpedBoolValue = Instance.new("BoolValue") HelpedBoolValue.Name = "WizardWandHelped" HelpedBoolValue.Value = true
function instantiateTip() Tip.Parent = game.Workspace TipWeld.Parent = game.Workspace Sparkles.Parent = Tip end
function changeSpell(key) -- You can only switch spells when you're not in the middle of casting one. This helps other -- users know what to prepare for. if not Tool.Enabled then return end local newKey = key:lower() if (newKey == "f" or newKey == "x" or newKey == "e") then Tool.SpellKey.Value = newKey if newKey == "x" then Sparkles.SparkleColor = Color3.new(0, 1, 1) elseif newKey == "e" then Sparkles.SparkleColor = Color3.new(75/255, 0, 130/255) else --[[newKey == "f"]] Sparkles.SparkleColor = Color3.new(1, 0, 0) end end end
function onLeftMouseDown() CloneScript = Tool:FindFirstChild("DrawSpell") if CloneScript then -- Changing tool's Grip: Tool.GripForward = Vector3.new(0, 0, 1) Tool.GripPos = Vector3.new(0, 0, -0.48) Tool.GripRight = Vector3.new(0, 1, 0) Tool.GripUp = Vector3.new(1, 0, 0) CloneScript = CloneScript:Clone() CloneScript.Parent = Tool CloneScript.Name = "RunningDrawSpell" CloneScript.Disabled = false end end
function onEquipped(mouse) if mouse then myMouse.Value = mouse mouse.KeyDown:connect(changeSpell) mouse.Button1Down:connect(onLeftMouseDown) end -- Get references to myCharacter and RightShoulder, to be used later myCharacter = Tool.Parent if myCharacter then Torso = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Torso") if Torso then RightShoulder = Torso:FindFirstChild("Right Shoulder") end -- Also display help message if necessary. myPlayer = game.Players:GetPlayerFromCharacter(myCharacter) if myPlayer then if not myPlayer:FindFirstChild("WizardWandHelped") then HelpGui.Parent = myPlayer.PlayerGui debris:AddItem(HelpGui, 5) HelpedBoolValue.Parent = myPlayer end end end
instantiateTip() end
function onUnequipped() Tip.Parent = nil TipWeld.Parent = nil Sparkles.Parent = nil if Tool.Parent == game.Workspace then --i.e. if the tool was backspaced, then... if myCharacter then Torso = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Torso") if Torso then Wand.Position = Torso.Position + 8 * Torso.CFrame.lookVector + Vector3.new(0, 7, 0) end end if Tool:FindFirstChild("SpellKey") then Tool.SpellKey.Value = "f" end end end
Tool.Equipped:connect(onEquipped) Tool.Unequipped:connect(onUnequipped)

---------CHECKS/VARIABLES------------------- local Tool = script.Parent local myCharacter = Tool.Parent if not myCharacter then script:Remove() end local Torso = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Torso") local RightArm = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Right Arm") local myPlayer = game.Players:GetPlayerFromCharacter(myCharacter) if not (myPlayer and Torso and RightArm) then script:Remove() end
local myHumanoid local TargetPoint
local myMouse = Tool.Mouse.Value if not myMouse then script:Remove() end
if not Tool.Enabled then script:Remove() end
Tool.Enabled = false
local key = "f" if Tool:FindFirstChild("SpellKey") then key = Tool.SpellKey.Value end
local moveConnection local upConnection
local DingSound = Tool:FindFirstChild("DingSound") local ShotSound = Tool:FindFirstChild("ShotSound") if ShotSound then print "ShotSound exists" end
local buttonUpdateConnections = {}
local RightShoulder = Torso:FindFirstChild("Right Shoulder")
local XOffset local YOffset
local NewShoulder = Instance.new("Weld") NewShoulder.Name = "Right Shoulder" --LOL HAX NewShoulder.Part0 = Torso NewShoulder.Part1 = RightArm NewShoulder.C0 = CFrame.new(1, 0.5, 0) NewShoulder.C1 = CFrame.new(-0.5, 0.5, 0) * CFrame.Angles(-math.pi/2, 0, 0) -- (That CFrame is the standard "weapon equipped" position, w/ weld location at the shoulder.)
NewShoulder.Parent = Torso if RightShoulder then RightShoulder.Parent = nil end
local SpellScript
local ScreenGui = Tool.WizardWandSpellGui:Clone() ScreenGui.Parent = myPlayer.PlayerGui local Frame = ScreenGui.SpellFrame local Background = Frame.SpellBackground local Button1 = Frame.Button1 local Button2 = Frame.Button2 local Button3 = Frame.Button3 local Button4 = Frame.Button4 local Button5 = Frame.Button5 local Button6 = Frame.Button6 local Button7 = Frame.Button7
local prevButton = nil local finalButton
local initialBackgroundImage
local Buttons = { Button1, Button2, Button3, Button4, Button5, Button6, Button7}
local initialButtonImages = { Button1.Image, Button2.Image, Button3.Image, Button4.Image, Button5.Image, Button6.Image, Button7.Image}
local glowingButtonImages = { "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=56484059", "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=56485109", "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=56484129", "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=56484170", "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=56484211", "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=56484252", "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=56484282"}
-- Change buttons' positions and the overall background image based on spell chosen, which we determine from Tool.SpellKey -- ... -- For now: if key == "f" then Button1.Position = UDim2.new(0, 258, 0, 346) Button2.Position = UDim2.new(0, 82, 0, 320) Button3.Position = UDim2.new(0, 201, 0, 220) Button4.Position = UDim2.new(0, 277, 0, 148) Button5.Position = UDim2.new(0, 109, 0, 103) Button6.Position = UDim2.new(0, 246, 0, 27) Button7.Visible = false finalButton = Button6 Background.Image = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=56478450" elseif key == "x" then Button1.Position = UDim2.new(0, 15, 0, 101) Button2.Position = UDim2.new(0, 216, 0, -7) Button3.Position = UDim2.new(0, 414, 0, 106) Button4.Position = UDim2.new(0, 415, 0, 324) Button5.Position = UDim2.new(0, 216, 0, 433) Button6.Position = UDim2.new(0, 11, 0, 323) Button7.Position = UDim2.new(0, 215, 0, 215) finalButton = Button7 Background.Image = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=56479374" else -- key == "e" Button1.Position = UDim2.new(0, 130, 0, 220) Button2.Position = UDim2.new(0, 75, 0, 312) Button3.Position = UDim2.new(0, 314, 0, 253) Button4.Position = UDim2.new(0, 174, 0, 118) Button5.Position = UDim2.new(0, 316, 0, 142) Button6.Visible = false Button7.Visible = false finalButton = Button5 Background.Image = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=56479482" end
initialBackgroundImage = Background.Image
---------FUNCTIONS------------- function moveArmWithMouse() LookVector = Torso.CFrame.lookVector XOffset = (myMouse.X - Frame.AbsolutePosition.X - 175) / 175 YOffset = (myMouse.Y - Frame.AbsolutePosition.Y - 175) / 175 NewShoulder.C1 = CFrame.new(-0.5, 0.5, 0) * CFrame.Angles(-math.pi/2 + math.atan(YOffset/2), math.atan(XOffset/2), 0) end
function moveArmWithMouseOnButton(x, y) LookVector = Torso.CFrame.lookVector XOffset = (x - Frame.AbsolutePosition.X - 175) / 175 YOffset = (y - Frame.AbsolutePosition.Y - 175) / 175 NewShoulder.C1 = CFrame.new(-0.5, 0.5, 0) * CFrame.Angles(-math.pi/2 + math.atan(YOffset/2), math.atan(XOffset/2), 0) end
-- This function updates the background to its spell-ready version. function updateBackground() if (key == "f") then Background.Image = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=56478556" elseif (key == "x") then Background.Image = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=56479425" else --[[key == "e"]] Background.Image = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=56479531" end end
function endDrawing() -- Erase the Gui... ScreenGui:Remove() -- Re-enable the tool... Tool.Enabled = true -- Change grip back to normal... Tool.GripForward = Vector3.new(0, -1, 0) Tool.GripPos = Vector3.new(0, 0.02, -0.58) Tool.GripRight = Vector3.new(-1, 0, 0) Tool.GripUp = Vector3.new(0, 0, 1) -- And replace the shoulder. if RightShoulder then RightShoulder.Parent = Torso NewShoulder.Parent = nil end script:Remove() end
function castSpell() if (key == "f") then SpellScript = script:FindFirstChild("FireScript") elseif (key == "x") then SpellScript = script:FindFirstChild("IceScript") else --[[key == "e"]] SpellScript = script:FindFirstChild("PoisonScript") end
if ShotSound then ShotSound:Play() end if SpellScript then SpellScript = SpellScript:Clone() SpellScript.Parent = Tool SpellScript.Disabled = false end
endDrawing() end
-- This function, combined with a bunch of event connections, ensures that all the buttons are traversed, -- in order, before the spell is cast. function buttonUpdate(currButtonIndex, idealPrevButtonIndex) if prevButton == Buttons[idealPrevButtonIndex] then if DingSound then DingSound:Play() end local currButton = Buttons[currButtonIndex] local newLabel = Instance.new("ImageLabel") newLabel.Size = currButton.Size newLabel.Position = currButton.Position newLabel.BackgroundTransparency = 1.0 newLabel.Image = glowingButtonImages[currButtonIndex] currButton:Remove() newLabel.Parent = Frame prevButton = currButton if prevButton == finalButton then updateBackground() upConnection:disconnect() for i = 1, #buttonUpdateConnections do buttonUpdateConnections[i]:disconnect() end myMouse.Button1Up:connect(castSpell) end end end
--------CONNECTIONS------------------------ buttonUpdateConnections[1] = Button1.MouseEnter:connect(function() buttonUpdate(1, 0) end) for i = 2, #Buttons do buttonUpdateConnections[i] = Buttons[i].MouseEnter:connect(function() buttonUpdate(i,i-1) end) end for i = 1, #Buttons do Buttons[i].MouseButton1Up:connect(endDrawing) Buttons[i].MouseMoved:connect(moveArmWithMouseOnButton) end moveConnection = myMouse.Move:connect(moveArmWithMouse) upConnection = myMouse.Button1Up:connect(endDrawing)
Tool.Unequipped:connect(endDrawing)

local Tool = script.Parent local myCharacter = Tool.Parent if not myCharacter then script:Remove() end local Torso = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Torso") local myHumanoid = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") if not (Torso and myHumanoid) then script:Remove() end
local myPlayer
local debris = game:GetService("Debris")
function tagAndUntagHumanoid(humanoid, player) local Tag = Instance.new("ObjectValue") Tag.Name = "creator" Tag.Value = player Tag.Parent = humanoid debris:AddItem(Tag, 8) -- Extra time to include time-based fire damage. end
-- Again, multiple triggers are an issue -> basic debounce. function fireBlow(hit) if hit:FindFirstChild("WizardWandFireHit") then return end local hitThing = hit.Parent if (hitThing == myCharacter)then return end if (hitThing.ClassName == "Hat" or hitThing.ClassName == "Tool") and hitThing.Parent == myCharacter then return end if hit.Name == "Wizard Wand Tip" then return end
local HitRegisterer = Instance.new("BoolValue") HitRegisterer.Name = "WizardWandFireHit" HitRegisterer.Parent = hit debris:AddItem(HitRegisterer, 0.2)
local hitHumanoid = hitThing:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") if hitHumanoid then myPlayer = game.Players:GetPlayerFromCharacter(myCharacter) if myPlayer then tagAndUntagHumanoid(hitHumanoid, myPlayer) hitHumanoid:TakeDamage(10) end end local HitFireScript = script:FindFirstChild("LitOnFire") if HitFireScript then HitFireScript = HitFireScript:Clone() HitFireScript.Parent = hit HitFireScript.Disabled = false end end
local FlamingPart = Instance.new("Part") FlamingPart.Shape = Enum.PartType.Ball FlamingPart.Size = Vector3.new(5, 5, 5) FlamingPart.CanCollide = false FlamingPart.Transparency = 1.0 FlamingPart.Locked = true FlamingPart.CFrame = Torso.CFrame FlamingPart.Velocity = 100 * (myHumanoid.TargetPoint - Torso.Position).unit FlamingPart.Name = "WizardWandFireball" FlamingPart.Parent = game.Workspace
local AntiGrav = Instance.new("BodyForce") AntiGrav.force = Vector3.new(0, 196.2 * FlamingPart:GetMass(), 0) AntiGrav.Parent = FlamingPart
local Fire = Instance.new("Fire") Fire.Size = 20 Fire.Heat = 20 Fire.Parent = FlamingPart
FlamingPart.Touched:connect(fireBlow)
wait(10) FlamingPart:Remove() script:Remove()

local Part = script.Parent local hitCharacter = Part.Parent local hitHumanoid = hitCharacter:FindFirstChild("Humanoid")
local Fire = Instance.new("Fire") Fire.Size = Part:GetMass() * 2 Fire.Heat = Part:GetMass() * 2 Fire.Parent = Part
if hitHumanoid then for i = 1, 5 do hitHumanoid:TakeDamage(1) wait(1) end else wait(5) end
Fire:Remove() script:Remove()

local Tool = script.Parent local myCharacter = Tool.Parent if not myCharacter then script:Remove() end local Torso = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Torso") local myHumanoid = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") if not (Torso and myHumanoid) then script:Remove() end
local myPlayer
local debris = game:GetService("Debris")
local IceBall = Instance.new("Part") IceBall.Shape = Enum.PartType.Ball IceBall.Material = "Ice" IceBall.BrickColor = BrickColor.new("Pastel blue-green") IceBall.Size = Vector3.new(3, 3, 3) IceBall.Locked = true IceBall.CanCollide = false IceBall.Name = "WizardWandIceBall" IceBall.Parent = game.Workspace IceBall.CFrame = Torso.CFrame IceBall.Velocity = 100 * (myHumanoid.TargetPoint - Torso.Position).unit
local AntiGrav = Instance.new("BodyForce") AntiGrav.force = Vector3.new(0, 196.2 * IceBall:GetMass(), 0) AntiGrav.Parent = IceBall
local IceFire = Instance.new("Fire") IceFire.Color = IceBall.BrickColor.Color IceFire.SecondaryColor = Color3.new(1, 1, 1) IceFire.Size = 6 IceFire.Heat = 10 IceFire.Parent = IceBall
function tagAndUntagHumanoid(humanoid, player) local Tag = Instance.new("ObjectValue") Tag.Name = "creator" Tag.Value = player Tag.Parent = humanoid debris:AddItem(Tag, 1) end
-- Some issues with multiple triggers on this one, so some basic debouncing included function iceBlow(hit) if hit:FindFirstChild("WizardWandIceHit") then return end print(hit.Name) local hitThing = hit.Parent -- Checks to make sure the ice only affects things that aren't us -- or attached to us. if (hitThing == myCharacter) or (hitThing == Tool) or (hitThing.ClassName == "Hat" and hitThing.Parent == myCharacter) or (hit.Name == "Wizard Wand Tip") then return end
-- Add a BoolValue for debounce purposes local HitRegisterer = Instance.new("BoolValue") HitRegisterer.Name = "WizardWandIceHit" HitRegisterer.Parent = hit debris:AddItem(HitRegisterer, 0.2)
-- Delete any meshes underneath the thing we hit, and turn it to ice. local hitChildren = hit:GetChildren() local meshTable = {} for index, instance in pairs(hitChildren) do local className = instance.ClassName if (className == "SpecialMesh" or className == "BlockMesh" or className == "CylinderMesh") then instance.Parent = nil table.insert(meshTable, instance) end end local oldMaterial = hit.Material local oldBrickColor = hit.BrickColor hit.Material = "Ice" hit.BrickColor = BrickColor.new("Pastel blue-green")
-- Have a chance of removing the hit part if it was attached to a character -- frostbite FTL. local hitHumanoid = hitThing:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") if hitThing.ClassName == "Hat" then hitHumanoid = hitThing.Parent:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") end if hitHumanoid then if myCharacter then myPlayer = game.Players:GetPlayerFromCharacter(myCharacter) tagAndUntagHumanoid(hitHumanoid, myPlayer) end hitHumanoid:TakeDamage(10) if (math.random() > 0.85) then hitHumanoid:TakeDamage(15) local hitCharacter = hitHumanoid.Parent local hitTorso = hitCharacter:FindFirstChild("Torso")
local MotorToRemove if hitThing.ClassName == "Hat" or hit.Name == "Head" or hit.Name == "Torso" then MotorToRemove = hitTorso:FindFirstChild("Neck") elseif hit.Name == "Right Arm" then MotorToRemove = hitTorso:FindFirstChild("Right Shoulder") elseif hit.Name == "Right Leg" then MotorToRemove = hitTorso:FindFirstChild("Right Hip") elseif hit.Name == "Left Arm" then MotorToRemove = hitTorso:FindFirstChild("Left Shoulder") else --[[ hit.Name == "Left Leg"]] MotorToRemove = hitTorso:FindFirstChild("Left Hip") end
if MotorToRemove then MotorToRemove.Parent = nil end end end
-- Wait for the ice to thaw... wait(10) -- Then set things back to normal. if hit then -- We just need to check that the "old" material and color aren't those of ice, which -- they would be if we hit the same target twice in a row. (We don't want to accidentally -- freeze things forever!) if oldMaterial ~= hit.Material then hit.Material = oldMaterial end if oldBrickColor ~= hit.BrickColor then hit.BrickColor = oldBrickColor end for i = 1, #meshTable do meshTable[i].Parent = hit end end end
IceBall.Touched:connect(iceBlow)
wait(10) if IceBall then IceBall:Remove() end wait(11) -- To give the effects of iceBlow time to wear off. script:Remove()

local Tool = script.Parent local myCharacter = Tool.Parent if not myCharacter then script:Remove() end local myHumanoid = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") local Torso = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Torso") if not (myHumanoid and Torso) then script:Remove() end
local myPlayer
local debris = game:GetService("Debris")
local PoisonBall = Instance.new("Part") PoisonBall.Shape = Enum.PartType.Ball PoisonBall.BrickColor = BrickColor.new("Earth green") PoisonBall.Size = Vector3.new(3, 3, 3) PoisonBall.Material = "Concrete" PoisonBall.Locked = true PoisonBall.CanCollide = false PoisonBall.Name = "WizardWandPoisonBall" PoisonBall.Parent = game.Workspace PoisonBall.CFrame = Torso.CFrame PoisonBall.Velocity = 100 * (myHumanoid.TargetPoint - Torso.Position).unit
local AntiGrav = Instance.new("BodyForce") AntiGrav.force = Vector3.new(0, 196.2 * PoisonBall:GetMass(), 0) AntiGrav.Parent = PoisonBall
local PoisonFire = Instance.new("Fire") PoisonFire.Color = Color3.new(75/255, 0, 130/255) PoisonFire.SecondaryColor = Color3.new(75/255, 0, 130/255) PoisonFire.Size = 6 PoisonFire.Heat = 10 PoisonFire.Parent = PoisonBall
function tagAndUntagHumanoid(humanoid, player) local Tag = Instance.new("ObjectValue") Tag.Name = "creator" Tag.Value = player Tag.Parent = humanoid debris:AddItem(Tag, 17) --Extra time to include the time-based poison damage. end
function poisonBlow(hit) local hitThing = hit.Parent if (hitThing == myCharacter) or (hitThing == Tool) or (hitThing.ClassName == "Hat" and hitThing.Parent == myCharacter) or (hit.Name == "Wizard Wand Tip") then return end -- Don't poison the same part twice at the same time: if hit:FindFirstChild("WizardWandPoisoned") then return end local hitHumanoid = hitThing:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") if hitHumanoid then myPlayer = game.Players:GetPlayerFromCharacter(myCharacter) if myPlayer then tagAndUntagHumanoid(hitHumanoid, myPlayer) end local PoisonedScript = script:FindFirstChild("WizardWandPoisoned") if PoisonedScript then PoisonedScript = PoisonedScript:Clone() PoisonedScript.Parent = hit PoisonedScript.Disabled = false end end end
PoisonBall.Touched:connect(poisonBlow)
wait(10) PoisonBall:Remove() wait(5) script:Remove()

local Part = script.Parent local hitCharacter = Part.Parent if not hitCharacter then script:Remove() end local hitHumanoid = hitCharacter:FindFirstChild("Humanoid")
if hitHumanoid then local oldBrickColor = Part.BrickColor Part.BrickColor = BrickColor.new("Bright violet") for i = 1, 15 do hitHumanoid:TakeDamage(1.3) wait(1) end Part.BrickColor = oldBrickColor end
script:Remove()

Properties.string: Hold down the mouse button and touch the numbers in order to cast spells!
